HCCO serves as a vehicle to share that abundance that God has showered on us with those in need, while treating them with dignity and respect during difficult times.        \u201cI know that that there is nothing better for people than to be happy and to do good while they live. That each of them may eat, drink and find satisfaction in all their toil. This is the gift of God.\u201d  Ecclesiastes 3 vs 12-13      Vision Statement:    To be a sustainable ministry to serve the food insecurities of citizens of our City and County and to help our clients find a path of self-sustenance by connecting individuals and families to other community resources.      Values Statements:   We value:   Respect, compassion, and honesty in all interactions and activities.   The worth and diversity of every person.   The wise use of resources, creating new ways to improve services, and effectively utilizing community   support that sustains the work of the HCCO.   The diverse talents, backgrounds, passion and commitment to the community of our staff and volunteers.  Excellence in leadership including HCCO\u2019s role to be a servant leader and partner for social change.   Creativity, the pursuit of knowledge, and the sharing of expertise that results in social justice.", "notes": "HART Bus stop located at our facility.
